reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Strengthening the decentralization and integration of malaria, HIV and TB activities including implementation of key malaria interventions to achieve malaria elimination

description.narrative: Sao Tome and Principe - Multicomponent - Ministry of Health of Sao Tome and Principe - MOH. This program has the following goals: The goal of the HIV program is to stabilize the morbidity amongst people living with HIV/AIDS at 0.06 per 1,000 inhabitants and reduce mortality from 28.1 in 2015 to 6,81 per 100,000 inhabitants by 2023. Increase the treatment success rate for all forms of TB that have been bacteriologically confirmed and clinically diagnosed from 70% in 2018 to ≥85% by 2024. By 2025, reduce the incidence of malaria by at least 1 case per 1,000 inhabitants within all of the districts of São Tomé and record 0 (zero) endemic cases within the Autonomous Region of Príncipe. The objectives of this program are: Strengthen preventive measures to reduce the number of new HIV / AIDS infections and TB infections. Reduce morbidity and mortality from tuberculosis and HIV/AIDS by improving patient care. Reach all key and vulnerable populations by improving human rights in relation to services. Improve active case finding interventions and ensure linkage between diagnosis and treatment. Strengthen the epidemiological and entomological surveillance system, as well as the monitoring and evaluation system at all level including RAP , as well as the detection and response to epidemics;. Detect 100% of malaria cases at all levels, with a quality biological diagnosis and treat correctly in accordance with the national case management policy;. Accelerate the implementation of activities towards malaria elimination with robust surveillance system. Ensure the implementation of the health information management system fully deployed and functional at all levels (DHIS2)

title.narrative: Outcome indicator for STP-Z-MOH
Annual blood examination rate: per 100 population per year (Elimination settings)
Percentage of people living with HIV and on ART who are virologically suppressed
Percentage of men reporting the use of a condom the last time they had anal sex with a non regular partner
Treatment success rate of RR TB and/or MDR-TB: Percentage of cases with RR and/or MDR-TB successfully treated
Impact indicator for STP-Z-MOH
TB mortality rate per 100,000 population
Reported malaria cases (presumed and confirmed)
Percentage of sex workers who are living with HIV
Coverage / Output indicator for STP-Z-MOH
Number of cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB that began second-line treatment
Number of long-lasting insecticidal nets distributed to at-risk populations through mass campaigns
Percentage of sex workers reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services
Percentage of confirmed cases fully investigated and classified
Percentage of men who have sex with men reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services
Number of notified cases of all forms of TB (i.e. bacteriologically confirmed + clinically diagnosed), new and relapse cases
Completeness of facility reporting: Percentage of expected facility monthly reports (for the reporting period) that are actually received
Proportion of suspected malaria cases that receive a parasitological test at public sector health facilities
Percentage of HIV-positive new and relapse TB patients on ART during TB treatment

Treatment success rate- all forms: Percentage of TB cases, all forms, bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed, successfully treated (cured plus treatment completed) among all TB cases registered for treatment during a specified period, new and relapse cases
Proportion of households in targeted areas that received Indoor Residual Spraying during the reporting period
Percentage of HIV-exposed infants receiving a virological test for HIV within 2 months of birth
Number of long-lasting insecticidal nets distributed to targeted risk groups through continuous distribution
Number of TB cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB notified
Percentage of new and relapse TB patients tested using WHO recommended rapid tests at the time of diagnosis
Percentage of people on ART among all people living with HIV at the end of the reporting period
